Container.Name: TeamSpeak6-Server-Beta
Container.Overview:
### Unraid Setup & Configuration
**Disclaimer:** I am not affiliated with, nor endorsed by, TeamSpeak Systems GmbH. All rights to the software and brand belong exclusively to TeamSpeak. For the official repository and documentation.
* **Registry URL:** https://hub.docker.com/r/teamspeaksystems/teamspeak6-server (Official Docker Hub page) * **Github URL:** https://github.com/teamspeak/teamspeak6-server (Official TS GitHub)
When applying this template in Unraid, the following key fields are used:
* **Name:** `TeamSpeak6-Server-Beta` (You can change this to your liking) * **Repository:** `teamspeaksystems/teamspeak6-server:latest` (Pulls the official Beta image)
* **Extra Parameters:** `--user 99:100` (Crucial! This forces the container to run with Unraid's default user permissions. Without this, the container will crash with a "Failed to create log directory" error because it lacks write access to your appdata folder).
### How to get your Admin Token (Privilege Key) On the very first start, the server will generate a one-time admin token. You need this to claim ownership of your server in the TS6 Client.
Simply click on the container icon in your Unraid Docker tab and select **Logs**. Look for the string `ServerAdmin privilege key` in the text output, copy the key behind it, and paste it into your TeamSpeak 6 Client when prompted.
